is it a drive, or a partition of a drive?
if you don't know, it's time to find out.
you have one physical hard disk that has been partitioned.
i would strongly suggest that before you investigate alternate OSes further you learn the difference between disks and partitions. otherwise you could really hose your system.
this is like you asking for directions on the highway, and when we tell you to steer left, you answer "STEER?! What the heck is 'steering'?!"
you have to walk before you can run.

so ... how many primary partitions can be on a disk with an MSDOS disklabel?
do you really want to be guessing as Linux formats huge portions of your hard drive? i wouldn't.
it's the same as knowing every road sign shape before you get your driver's license. there are just some things you should know.
